text: Birgir Ármannsson (born 12 June 1968 in Reykjavík, Iceland) is an Icelandic politician and a member of Independence Party. He has been working as a member of the Althing, Iceland's national parliament, since 2003. Ármannsson studied at the University of Iceland and later at King's College London, establishing a foundation in law. In his political career, Ármannsson held the position of Speaker of the Althing from 1 December 2021 until 1 December 2024 after Steingrímur J. Sigfússon. After him Ásthildur Lóa Þórsdóttir became the speaker. He is married to Ragnhildur Hjördís Lövdahl (born 1971), and they have three children: Erna (born 2003), Helga Kjaran (born 2005), and Hildur (born 2010). His parents are Ármann Sveinsson (1946–1968) and Helga Kjaran (born 1947). ==References== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Reykjavík
title: Birgir Ármannsson
